channel.title: Focus on Parenting Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Focus on the Family
channel.itunes:summary: Christian mom or dad, could you use some encouragement and support? Put your ear buds in for this Christian parenting podcast and get practical, faith-based inspiration through all stages of parenting — raising toddlers, navigating the school-age years, preparing for puberty, and seeing your teen soar with confidence. Hosted by Danny Huerta, in every 8 to 15 minute episode, you’ll hear parenting experts share Biblical truths, effective parenting techniques, and useful resources that will help you feel equipped as a mom or dad in today’s culture.
channel.description: Christian mom or dad, could you use some encouragement and support? Hosted by Danny Huerta, in every 8 to 15 minute episode, you’ll hear parenting experts share Biblical truths, effective parenting techniques, and useful resources that will help you feel equipped as a mom or dad in today’s culture.
channel.content:encoded: Christian mom or dad, could you use some encouragement and support? Put your ear buds in for this Christian parenting podcast and get practical, faith-based inspiration through all stages of parenting — raising toddlers, navigating the school-age years, preparing for puberty, and seeing your teen soar with confidence. Hosted by Danny Huerta, in every 8 to 15 minute episode, you’ll hear parenting experts share Biblical truths, effective parenting techniques, and useful resources that will help you feel equipped as a mom or dad in today’s culture.

item.title: Never Stop Being a Father Figure
item.itunes:author: Guest: Carey Casey
item.itunes:summary:
Regardless of what age your kids are, it's critical for dads to always strive to be a healthy father figure. John and Danny offer some encouragement on how to be a father figure in someone's life who doesn't currently have one. Featuring Carey Casey.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.


Receive the book "Championship Grandfathering: How to Build a Winning Legacy" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-09-27?refcd=1509003


Get more episode resources: http://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/never-stop-being-a-father-figure/#featured-resource-cta


Listen Anytime: https://store.focusonthefamily.com/being-a-champion-to-your-grandkids-digital-product/?refcd=1509003


If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback: https://focusonthefamily.com/podcastsurvey/

item.title: I Cannot Just Coast
item.itunes:author: Guest: Carey Casey
item.itunes:summary:
Whether you have grown kids or even grandchildren, you should never stop trying to help the next generation. John and Danny give some fun ideas for how you can keep investing in young kids. Featuring Carey Casey.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Helping vs. Enabling
item.itunes:author: Guest: Allison Bottke
item.itunes:summary:
If your adult child is about to make a bad decision, your reaction might be to step in and stop them. However, sometimes, the most loving thing you can do is let them face the consequences of their choices. John and Danny share why enabling bad behavior is never good for your parenting. Featuring Allison Bottke.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.


Receive the book "Setting Boundaries with Your Adult Children" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-10-25?refcd=1503505


Get more episode resources: http://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/helping-vs-enabling/#featured-resource-cta


Listen Anytime: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-10-25?refcd=1503505


If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback: https://focusonthefamily.com/podcastsurvey/

item.title: When Your Child Struggles to Launch
item.itunes:author: Guest: Allison Bottke
item.itunes:summary:
When a son or daughter struggles to launch well into adulthood, it can be heartbreaking for the parent. John and Danny share common reasons why kids have a hard time launching into maturity, and offer an opportunity to get help if your child is having trouble. Featuring Allison Bottke.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.


Receive the book "Setting Boundaries with Your Adult Children" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-10-25?refcd=1503505

item.title: Building Memories, Handling Frustrations
item.itunes:author: Guest: Julie Lavender
item.itunes:summary:
Making memories with your children is one of the best aspects of being a parent. Yet, every parent know that some moments are joyful while others are difficult. What do you do when parenting gets frustrating? John and Danny discuss the importance of creating memories with your children and how to respond well when you face frustration. Featuring Julie Lavender.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.


Receive the book "365 Ways to Love Your Child: Turning Little Moments into Lasting Memories" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-10-20?refcd=1500101


Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/building-memories-handling-frustrations/#featured-resource-cta


Listen Anytime: https://store.focusonthefamily.com/showing-love-to-your-child-every-day-digital-download/?refcd=1500101


If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback: https://focusonthefamily.com/podcastsurvey/

item.title: Thoughts for Handling Conflict
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Leman and Mrs. Daly
item.itunes:summary:
It's unrealistic to think you can get through parenting without having any conflict with your kids. In fact, conflict is actually an opportunity for your relationship to grow. John and Danny offer hope to strong-willed parents on how to handle conflict. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.


Receive the book "Why Your Kids Misbehave--And What to Do About It" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-05-31?refcd=1499104


Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/thoughts-for-handling-conflict/#featured-resource-cta


Listen Anytime: https://store.focusonthefamily.com/understanding-the-root-of-your-child-s-misbehavior-digital/?refcd=1499104

item.title: Cheerleader for the Hard Times
item.itunes:summary:
When your kids are figuring life out, at some point, they will encounter something difficult. John and Danny discuss how to be an encourager to your kids, and what you can do if your child isn't receiving encouragement. Featuring Chrys Howard and Shellie Tomlinson.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.


Receive the book "Rocking It Grand" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-09-13?refcd=1495107

item.title: "When You Need Me, I'm Here"
item.itunes:summary:
With so many changes happening in our world, it can sometimes be challenging for grandparents to feel like they're truly connecting with their grandchildren. John and Danny discuss how a simple phrase, "When you need me, I'm here," can go a long way in helping grandparents relate to their grandkids. Featuring Chrys Howard and Shellie Tomlinson.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.


Receive the book "Rocking It Grand" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-09-13?refcd=1495107


Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/when-you-need-me-im-here/#featured-resource-cta

item.title: Trust Through Serving & Taking Risks
item.itunes:summary:
It's been observed that actions speak louder than words. The same is true for how your kids can see that your faith is authentic. John and Danny share how you can live out your faith by serving others and taking risks. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.


﻿Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.


Receive the book "Faith for Exiles" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-05-12?refcd=1492101

Listen Anytime: https://store.focusonthefamily.com/helping-kids-retain-their-faith-digital-product/?refcd=1450403

item.title: Doubts & Giftings
item.itunes:summary:
All of us as Christians have battled with doubts at some point. Instead of pretending like we have faith figured out, it's good to let our kids see us be honest about doubts we've wrestled with. John and Danny share why doing so is important, plus they'll share ways to encourage your child in the things he or she is good at. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.description:
All of us as Christians have battled with doubts at some point. Instead of pretending like we have faith figured out, it's good to let our kids see us be honest about doubts we've wrestled with. John and Danny share why doing so is important, plus they'll share ways to encourage your child in the things he or she is good at. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

item.title: Discipline vs. Punishment
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Leman and Mrs. Daly
item.itunes:summary:
While disciplining your child is essential sometimes, it must be balanced with a healthy dose of love. John and Danny share how to reassure your kids that you love them, even after you have to correct something they did wrong. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.

item.title: Firstborn Parents & Having Fun
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Leman and Mrs. Daly
item.itunes:summary:
It's a common characteristic of firstborn children to be more of a rule follower personality. But no matter what your personality is, it's good to have fun with your children. John and Danny discuss how to have fun and ways to encourage your kids to be outward focused. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Seeing Prayer as a Conversation
item.itunes:author: Guest: Jodie Berndt
item.itunes:summary:
In the same way that you enjoy having good conversations with your kids, God wants to talk to you. But how do you make prayer a consistent part of your life? John and Danny discuss the power of prayer, and how praying for their children has changed as their kids have grown. Featuring Jodie Berndt.

item.title: Behavior and Your Birth Order
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Leman and Mrs. Daly
item.itunes:summary:
It's common for a firstborn child to be a rule follower while younger kids tend to be more free-spirited. Yet sometimes, a child will break out of that paradigm. John asks Danny about times he's seen kids not follow the birth-order pattern. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Bad Behavior and Doing Activities
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Leman and Mrs. Daly
item.itunes:summary:
Any parent will tell you that you don't have to train your child to misbehave. But what if the reason your child is acting up is because he or she is doing too many activities. John and Danny talk about how to discern if your child is involved in too many things. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Your Daughter's Need for Attention
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Meg Meeker
item.itunes:summary:
The needs that a daughter has versus a son are incredibly different. One of the worst things that can happen for your girl is for her to feel like she hasn't been heard. John and Danny discuss what some of the common needs are for every daughter. Featuring Dr. Meg Meeker.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Sharing Why You Love God
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Meg Meeker
item.itunes:summary:
Rather than hearing you preach about staying away from what's wrong, your child wants to know that your relationship with God is authentic. John and Danny share how you can have conversations with your kids about God, and balance them with discussing what's right and wrong. Featuring Dr. Meg Meeker.

item.title: Where is God in This?
item.itunes:summary:
When your son or daughter wants to discuss something difficult going on in the culture, your first reaction might be to shrink back in fear. However, that could be the perfect moment to share your faith. John and Danny give some helpful questions you can ask your kids when they want to talk about pressing cultural issues and entertainment. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Pointing to a Relationship with Jesus
item.itunes:summary:
As your child enters the teen phase, it will likely be a time where you may need to have difficult conversations about God and faith. Yet, those discussions could be a wonderful opportunity to connect with your son or daughter. John and Danny share how engaging in awkward conversations can be a gateway to your child having a better understanding of the gospel. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: The Great Balance of Parenting
item.itunes:summary:
Disciplining your child is critically important for helping him or her develop as a person. But if you overuse discipline, it can backfire on you as a parent. John and Danny explain why it's good to not repeat yourself too much when asking your kids to do something. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Teaching Your Kids Relational Skills
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Leman and Mrs. Daly
item.itunes:summary:
Teaching your kids good relational skills doesn't happen by accident. But what do you do when one parent isn't around or involved in your children's lives? John and Danny offer some hope to parents who are trying to raise their kids without another person's help. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Meg Meeker
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Talking to Your Daughter About Sex
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Meg Meeker
item.itunes:summary:
It's not easy to talk to your daughter about sex. But, if you don't have those types of conversations, she'll get her input of what's right and wrong from other influences. John and Danny share when it's a good time to talk to your daughter about sexuality, and give hope to parents whose daughter has already crossed some boundary lines. Featuring Dr. Meg Meeker.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Receive the book "Raising a Strong Daughter in a Toxic Culture" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-04-28?refcd=1440302

item.title: Praying for Your Child's Tech Use
item.itunes:author: Guest: Jodie Berndt
item.itunes:summary:
While having rules is good for your kids, truth be told, your rules can only go so far in changing their hearts. The same is true for the ways your child makes decisions with handling technology. John talks with Danny about ways he's learned to talk to his kids about using technology. Featuring Jodie Berndt.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Praying for a Struggling Child
item.itunes:author: Guest: Jodie Berndt
item.itunes:summary:
If your child has left the faith, it's one of the saddest things you can discover as a parent. However, it doesn't have to be the end of the story. John and Danny discuss why praying for your child is still effective, even if your son or daughter isn't walking with Christ. Featuring Jodie Berndt.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: How to Hear from God About Your Kids
item.itunes:summary:
Sometimes as a parent, you want to make a decision. Yet, deep inside you feel like God is telling you to do something different. Danny tells John about a time he had to follow God's lead when he didn't feel like it, and provides some insights on how to hear from the Lord about your parenting. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Why Kids Leave the Faith
item.itunes:summary:
Sadly, many children who grew up in church have turned away from the faith. If you have a child who is far from God, we want to offer you some hope. John and Danny provide a dose of encouragement to parents whose child isn't walking with the Lord. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

item.itunes:author: Guest: Kevin Leman
item.itunes:summary:
Rules are designed to keep your child safe. So, how do you respond when your son hates rules? John and Danny share how you can show your child respect, even when giving him rules. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Encouraging Healthy Femininity
item.itunes:author: Guest: Dr. Meg Meeker
item.itunes:summary:
Our daughters are constantly fed lies from the culture on what it means to be strong. But even with so many mixed messages, you can model a better way for her. John and Danny offer some encouragement on how you can show your daughter what true strength is. Featuring Dr. Meg Meeker.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:author: Guest: Jodie Berndt

item.title: Four Categories of Faith
item.itunes:summary:
At some point, your child must decide whether or not he or she will follow God. Sadly, many teens and young adults have walked away from the faith they were raised with. John and Danny share some common reasons why kids leave the faith, and offer a word of hope to parents whose child is far from God. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Receive the book "Faith for Exiles" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-05-12?refcd=1423105

Listen Anytime: https://store.focusonthefamily.com/helping-kids-retain-their-faith-digital-product/?refcd=1423105

item.title: Teen Sons & Substance Abuse
item.itunes:author: Guest: Jonathan McKee
item.itunes:summary:
Many kids and teens today are being influenced by things they see on social media. While it has it's good sides, social media can also cause your child to compare themselves with others. John and Danny share how you can encourage your child to be more outward focused in a world driven by screens. Featuring Jonathan McKee.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Telling Your Kids About Jesus
item.itunes:author: Guest: Natasha Crain
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: The Power of Listening & Asking Questions
item.itunes:author: Guest: Connie Albers
item.itunes:summary:
When your teen does something you don't like, it's easy to respond harshly. However, sometimes, it's better to ask questions than to demand your child behave a certain way. John and Danny share how they've seen listening be a powerful tool for parents. Featuring Connie Albers.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Helping Your Child Process Disappointment
item.itunes:author: Guest: Shelia Erwin
item.itunes:summary:
There are moments where your child will encounter disappointment. While those situations can be tough, it's also a wonderful opportunity to train your child to respond with gratitude. John and Danny discuss why it's good to teach your son or daughter to give thanks to God in all circumstances. Featuring Sheila Erwin.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:author: Guest: Connie Albers
item.itunes:summary:
Having rules in your home is part of being a parent. But too much emphasis on rules can lead to rebellion. John and Danny address how being a cheerleader for your child might influence him or her to be less rebellious. Featuring Connie Albers.

item.title: Encouraging Different Gifts & Dreams
item.itunes:author: Guest: Shelia Erwin
item.itunes:summary:
Every child is uniquely designed by God with special talents. The key is in recognizing what your son or daughter is good at. John and Danny share how you can engage with your kid, even if your dreams and desires are very different from each other. Featuring Shelia Erwin.

item.title: Practicing Vulnerability as a Parent
item.itunes:author: Guests: Milan & Kay Yerkovich
item.itunes:summary:
If you try to be the perfect parent, sooner or later you will fall short. But when you mess up, how you respond can make or break a situation. John and Danny share how you can practice healthy vulnerability with your children, even when you've made a mistake. Featuring Milan and Kay Yerkovich.

item.title: Tension With Your Teen
item.itunes:author: Guest: Rhonda Stoppe
item.itunes:summary:
As your child becomes a teenager, it's very common for him or her to pull away, which can lead to a lot of tension in the relationship. In this discussion, you'll hear about how boys tend to pull away from their mothers, and John and Danny share about how fathers can connect with a teen daughter as she becomes more independent. Featuring Rhonda Stoppe.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get Rhonda Stoppe's book "Moms Raising Sons to be Men" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-11-16?refcd=1311602

Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/tension-with-your-teen/#featured-resource-cta

item.title: Mothers Respecting Their Sons
item.itunes:author: Guest: Rhonda Stoppe
item.itunes:summary:
Even from a young age, boys want to be respected. As a mom, you have a unique and wonderful opportunity to show him a healthy version of what that looks like. But what if you feel like you've missed some opportunities? John and Danny offer hope to parents who feel like they didn't teach their sons healthy respect. Featuring Rhonda Stoppe.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get Rhonda Stoppe's book "Moms Raising Sons to be Men" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-11-16?refcd=1311602

item.title: Letting Them Make Mistakes
item.itunes:author: Guest: Crystal Paine
item.itunes:summary:
As your child grows, he or she will make mistakes. But instead of shielding them from all their errors, it's best to let them try and learn. John and Danny offer encouragement to parents who are afraid to let their kids make decisions for themselves. Featuring Crystal Paine.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Listening with Humility
item.itunes:author: Guest: Crystal Paine
item.itunes:summary:
When your child wants to tell you something, your first instinct might be to try and solve the problem. But what if one of the most effective things you can do is listen? John and Danny discuss how listening to your child can help improve the relationship with him or her. Featuring Crystal Paine.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: When Your Child is Far from God
item.itunes:author: Guests: Matt & Lisa Jacobson
item.itunes:summary:
If you have a child who's far from God, you are not alone. While it can be one of the most heartbreaking things a parent may face, your child's story is not over. John and Danny offer hope to parents who have a child who's not walking with the Lord. Featuring Matt and Lisa Jacobson.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Parenting or Your Career?
item.itunes:author: Guests: Matt & Lisa Jacobson
item.itunes:summary:
Raising a child takes an extraordinary amount of time and commitment. At some point, you'll have to give up something in order to spend time with your son or daughter. John and Danny share about how they wrestled with balancing their careers and raising kids. Featuring Matt and Lisa Jacobson.

item.title: Reasons for Your Child's Emotions
item.itunes:author: Guests: Milan & Kay Yerkovich
item.itunes:summary:
You get home after a long and exhausting day at work. But instead of coming home to a peaceful environment, your kids are at odds with each other. Sound familiar? Danny and John offer some ideas for listening to your child's emotions, even when you don't feel like it. Featuring Milan and Kay Yerkovich.

item.title: Grace for Your Child's Mistakes
item.itunes:author: Guest: Crystal Paine
item.itunes:summary:
The Bible reminds us that God has shown us more grace than we deserve. As parents, we're given a beautiful and unique opportunity to point our kids to His kindness and love. John and Danny discuss ways you can show your kid grace, even when he or she messes up. Featuring Crystal Paine.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get Crystal Paine's book "Love-Centered Parenting" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-12-09?refcd=1298702

Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/grace-for-your-childs-mistakes/#featured-resource-cta

If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback: https://focusonthefamily.com/podcastsurvey/

item.title: Relationship Over Reputation
item.itunes:author: Guest: Crystal Paine
item.itunes:summary:
We've all been guilty of wondering, "What do others think about my parenting?" While self-awareness is healthy, being obsessed with your reputation as a mom or dad is not good. John and Danny share promises from God's Word you can cling to as a parent. Featuring Crystal Paine.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Healthy Respect and Good Boundaries
item.itunes:author: Guest: Matt Jacobson
item.itunes:summary:
Watching your son or daughter make choices on their own can be exciting, but also nerve-wracking. But what do you do when he or she is determined to do things without your input? Danny and John give some tips on when it might be a good time to draw boundaries with your son or daughter. Featuring Matt Jacobson.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Receive the Jacobsons' book "100 Ways to Love Your Son" or their book "100 Ways to Love Your Daughter" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-10-07?refcd=1292202

Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-marriage-podcast/healthy-respect-and-good-boundaries/#featured-resource-cta

item.title: Giving Consistent Encouragement

item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Patterns of a Pleaser
item.itunes:author: Guests: Milan & Kay Yerkovich
item.itunes:summary:
How do you guide a child who wants to please everyone? While wanting to be liked is a good thing, trying to make everyone happy is a dangerous path for your son or daughter to walk. John and Danny discuss how to give your child a genuine confidence when he or she struggles with people pleasing. Featuring Milan and Kay Yerkovich.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get the Yerkovichs' book "How We Love Our Kids: The 5 Love Styles of Parenting" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-10-28?refcd=1289801

Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/patterns-of-a-pleaser/#featured-resource-cta

item.title: "Let's Talk About It"
item.itunes:author: Guests: Milan & Kay Yerkovich
item.itunes:summary:
When your son or daughter is young, he or she tends to look up to you. However, that usually changes when your child becomes a teenager. John and Danny share how admitting some of your own mistakes can help bridge a gap between you and your teen. Featuring Milan and Kay Yerkovich.

item.title: Don't Walk Away

item.itunes:summary:

item.title: When Mistakes Meet God's Grace
item.itunes:author: Guest: Mike Berry
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Correcting a Counterfeit

item.itunes:summary:

item.itunes:author: Guest: Heidi St. John

item.title: Breaking Patterns of Dysfunctional Parenting
item.itunes:author: Guest: Mike Berry
item.itunes:summary:
We all make mistakes as parents. But what do you do when a series of mistakes becomes an unhealthy pattern? The fact is, healing can take a long time. John and Danny describe how reconciliation is a process when you're trying to overcome the damage done by negative patterns. Featuring guest Mike Berry.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get Mike Berry's book "Winning the Heart of Your Child" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-10-12?refcd=1154801

item.title: The Root of the Behavior
item.itunes:summary:
You ask your child to do something, but instead of hearing "yes, Mom" or "yes, Dad," you get a negative response. Sound familiar? John and Danny explain why bad behavior is typically rooted in something much deeper that's going on in your child.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Truly Providing for Your Family
item.itunes:author: Guests: Matt & Lisa Jacobson
item.itunes:summary:
You want to provide for your kids' needs, but at the end of the day, what your child really wants is quality time with you. John and Danny share how they struggled to balance work with kids, and how they learned to make time for their families. Featuring guests Matt and Lisa Jacobson.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get the book "100 Ways to Love Your Son" or the book "100 Ways to Love Your Daughter" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-10-07?refcd=1151302

Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/truly-providing-for-your-family/#featured-resource-cta

item.title: Training for Adulthood
item.itunes:author: Guest: Cynthia Tobias
item.itunes:summary:
"Clean you room." "Do the dishes." "Don't punch your brother!" These are basic parenting instructions. But what do you do when your child isn't listening? John and Danny explain how big changes in your child's behavior start by focusing on one area at a time.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get Cynthia Tobias' book "You Can't Make Me (But I Can Be Persuaded)" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-08-12?refcd=1151802

item.itunes:summary:

item.title: The Reason Behind the Emotions
item.itunes:author: Guests: Josh & Christi Straub
item.itunes:summary:
An angry outburst! Sudden crying! Irrational behavior! Do these sound familiar? Many times, when your child has an outburst, there's usually a deeper reason under the surface. John and Danny discuss how to affirm your child when he or she is struggling emotionally.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:author: Guest: Tricia Goyer
item.itunes:summary:
When you have a great day, being thankful is easy. But what about when you have a bad day? John and Danny discuss how families can still be grateful, even during difficult circumstances.

item.title: Respecting a Child With a Strong Will
item.itunes:author: Guest: Cynthia Tobias
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: It's Not Too Late for a Miracle

item.title: Fight for a Better Future
item.itunes:author: Guest: Elizabeth Oates
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: How the Gospel Heals Parental Wounds
item.itunes:author: Guest: Elizabeth Oates
item.itunes:summary:
In the Bible, God is compared to a loving father. But, if a person didn't have a good father in the home, he or she might turn away from the Lord. John and Danny offer hope to parents who have a child who's far from God.

item.title: Developing Confidence On and Off the Field
item.itunes:author: Featured Guest: Dr. David Clarke
item.itunes:summary:
Less than one percent of little league players make it to the major leagues. But even if your child doesn't become a professional athlete, playing sports is a valuable learning opportunity. John and Danny offer tips for helping your child gain confidence.

item.title: Connecting With Distant Teens
item.itunes:author: Dr. Kara Powell
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Becoming a Clutter-Free Family, Part 4
item.itunes:author: John Fuller & Danny Huerta
item.itunes:summary: Many of us are blessed to be able to just go down to the corner store and get the things we need, like plastic bins to try to keep things organized, but sometimes the problem is that we just have too much stuff. John and Danny show how kids need to learn how to be content with what they have because when parents give them everything they want, often that stuff just adds to clutter around the house.

item.title: Disciplining Your Kids With Love and Limits, Part 2
item.itunes:author: John Fuller & Danny Huerta
item.itunes:summary: In a conversation centered on their book Put the Disciple Into Discipline, Erin MacPherson and her mother, Ellen Schuknecht, discuss the importance of parents demonstrating love in the midst of disciplining their children. Erin and Ellen also talk about teaching our kids self-control, helping them (and ourselves) become slow to anger, and faith training. Receive the book Put the Disciple into Discipline for your donation of any amount!
